#Info about the altivec-archc project.

= Altivec-ArchC =

[http://www.systemc.org SystemC] is a widely used system description language; SystemC is set of library routines and macros implemented in C++, which makes it possible to simulate concurrent processes, described by ordinary C++ syntax.

[http://www.archc.org ArchC] is an architecture description language that generates SystemC code.

Our project extends an existing ArchC model, [http://archc.sourceforge.net/index.php%3Fmodule=pagemaster&PAGE_user_op=view_page&PAGE_id=8&MMN_position=17:17.html the PowerPC one], to include the Altivec instructions. 

Altivec instructions are specified in the chapter 5 of [http://altivec-archc.googlecode.com/files/PowerISA_Public.pdf PowerIsa specification].
